The Elder Koṭumbariya’s Birth Story
Shining like a kanikāra flower,
sitting in the middle of a mountain,
like an immeasurable ocean,
like the earth that is vast.
Honored by a group of gods,
like a lion’s roar,
with a mind full of joy,
I approached the highest of men.
Having raised seven flowers,
full of koṭumburu,
I scattered them on the Buddha,
Sikhī, the one who binds the world.
In the twenty-ninth eon from now,
the flower I scattered then,
I do not remember any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
In the twenty-first eon from now,🔽named Mahānela,
there was one of great splendor,
a powerful wheel-turning king.
The four analytical knowledges,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus did the Elder Koṭumbariya recite these verses.
